revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse in Caen, Normandy
tldr: This article documents the observations of the solar eclipse on August 16, 1765, in Caen, Normandy. The author, Nathanael Pigott, records the eclipse's details, including the time, duration, and the difference in the Moon's latitude compared to the tables. The observations were made using an achromatic refractor of 6 feet and a micrometer made by Dollond.
